note.p: Literally “plank door” (Kroll, digital edition), banmen 版門 is a traditional form of door used in Chinese gates or buildings. The character 版 can be written as 板. The door consists of several components: zhouban 肘版 (elbow-hinge stile with pivots), fuzhouban 副肘版 (lock stile), and shenkouban 身口版 (body planks). The door leaves are mounted on a difu 地栿 (ground sill), beneath a men’e 門額 (header lintel), and between lijia 立頰 (jambs). They are secured by menzan 門簪 (door pegs) and jiqimu 雞棲木 (pivot-bearing bars). The size of each component is determined by specific proportions relative to the door height.

The construction of banmen is documented in detail in both the Yingzao fashi and Zirenyizhi treatises （Xue 1522, 3518.18a-20a）. The Yingzao fashi describes two types: single-leaf and double-leaf doors. Double-leaf doors are approximately square in proportion or slightly taller, ranging from 2.19 to 7.51 meters in height. The Zirenyizhi establishes a minimum height of 1.57 meters for single-leaf doors. Compared to the Yingzaofashi, the Zirenyizhi version of banmen incorporates additional elements: ting (rail), limei (vertical leaf-lintel), and naomei (header leaf-lintel), while also increasing the height of the men e (header lintel). The banmen construction method described in the Yingzaofashi is more suitable for installations between columns, while the method detailed in the Zirenyizhi is better adapted for applications in thick-walled structures. Scholars believe both types of banmen were in use in ground-level buildings before the publication of the Yingzaofashi. （Yu, 2023）

In traditional paintings, banmen typically appear as city gates or the main entrances to building complexes, and occasionally as the central door of individual buildings. In tomb architecture, scholars generally define banmen as plain, smooth door leaves with difu (ground sill), lijia (jambs), men’e (door headerl), and menzan (door pegs) （）, a form evidenced in Han dynasty stone carvings.
“版門”又寫作“板門”，是建築中門的形式之一。根據《營造法式》，版門由長條木板（又分肘版，身口版，副肘版）拼合而成門扇，下有地栿門砧，側有立頰，上有門額、門簪、雞棲木等構件，各構件尺寸根據門高按 照比例而定。

版門的做法詳細出現在《營造法式》（1103）與《梓人遺制》（1261）中（薛 1522，3518.18a-20a）。《營造法式》將版門分為雙扇版門和獨扇版門，雙扇版門高寬為方形或略窄，門高約在2.19米到7.51米之間。 《梓人遺制》補充了獨扇版門的高度下限，在1.57米至2.19米之間。《梓人遺制》相較於《營造法式》，增加了桯，立楣，腦楣構件以及額寬。《營造法式》中版門的做法適用於兩柱之間，《梓人遺製》則更適用於使用厚墻的場合。有學者 （俞莉娜，2023）認為在法式成書之前，兩種版門皆已經存在於地面建築。
繪畫中的版門主要出現在建築院落的大門和城門，也有存在於建築單體大門的情況。在墓葬等的探討中，學者普遍會把無飾平整門扇配有地栿，立頰，額和門簪的形式定義為版門（）。目前，該形式可以追溯到漢代畫像石。 （屠居华.从商周到两汉时期的建筑形象探(三)[J].古建园林技术,1990(03):31-36.）

（梁思成，竹島卓一、潘谷西都對《營造法式》的版門做過復原研究（梁,2001,166;潘和何 2005,111；竹岛,1971,175）。梁思成與潘穀西繪圖與《營造法式》基本符合。目前存在模糊性的，一是副肘版使用範圍， 竹島卓一和《梓人遺制》傾向于門高一丈二尺以上方可使用，梁思成與潘穀西的復原在一丈高版門中已使用副肘版。由於版門門扇以木板拼合而成，當尺寸較大時，門扇自重變大而易於變形，故需增加副肘板以維持門扇形狀。二是搕鎖柱尺寸位置， 梁和潘的復原中搕鎖柱立於立頰後，寬度大於肘版及閘關徑之和；劉妍對城門版門的復原將搕鎖柱立於門扇後（劉妍，2012，112），尺寸上更符合法式記載，不過如此則意味著搕鎖柱是隨門之開關安裝、拆卸的。）
